problems.title: Check if Two Strings are Anagrams
problems.description:
Check if two given strings are anagrams of each other. Two strings are anagrams if they contain the same characters in the same frequency (ignoring case). Print "true" if anagrams, otherwise print "false".

Input Format:
First line contains first string.
Second line contains second string.

Output Format:
Print "true" if anagrams, otherwise print "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
listen
silent

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
hello
world

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
"listen" and "silent" contain same letters (l, i, s, t, e, n), so they are anagrams.
hintsList: Count frequency of each character in both strings. If frequencies match (ignoring case), they are anagrams.

problems.title: Find First Non-Repeating Character
problems.description:
Find and print the first non-repeating character in a string. If all characters repeat, print "No non-repeating character".

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the first non-repeating character, or "No non-repeating character" if none exists.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
programming

Sample Output
p

Sample Input
aabbcc

Sample Output
No non-repeating character

Explanation:
In "programming", 'p' is the first character that appears only once.
hintsList: Count frequency of each character. Then iterate through string and find first character with frequency 1.

problems.title: Remove All Duplicates from String
problems.description:
Remove all duplicate characters from the string, keeping only the first occurrence of each character. Print the resulting string.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the string with all duplicates removed, keeping first occurrence.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
programming

Sample Output
progamin

Sample Input
aabbcc

Sample Output
abc

Explanation:
In "programming", after removing duplicates: p-r-o-g-a-m-i-n (removed second 'r', 'm', 'g').
hintsList: Use a set or boolean array to track seen characters. Iterate through string and only add characters not seen before.

problems.title: Count Frequency of Each Character
problems.description:
Count and print the frequency of each character in the string. Print characters in the order they first appear, with their frequencies.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print each character and its frequency in the format "character: frequency", one per line, in order of first appearance.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
programming

Sample Output
p: 1
r: 2
o: 1
g: 2
a: 1
m: 2
i: 1
n: 1

Explanation:
Characters appear in order: p, r, o, g, a, m, i, n with their respective frequencies.
hintsList: Count frequency of all characters. Then iterate through string in original order and print only when you see character for first time.

problems.title: Check if String Has All Unique Characters
problems.description:
Check if the given string has all unique characters (no character repeats). Print "true" if all characters are unique, otherwise print "false".

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print "true" if all characters are unique, otherwise print "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abc

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
hello

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
"abc" has all unique characters. "hello" has 'l' repeated, so it's false.
hintsList: Use a set to track seen characters. If a character is already in set, return false. Otherwise, add it to set.

problems.title: Reverse Words in a String
problems.description:
Reverse the order of words in a given string. Words are separated by spaces. Print the string with words reversed.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the string with words in reverse order.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World Java

Sample Output
Java World Hello

Sample Input
the sky is blue

Sample Output
blue is sky the

Explanation:
Reverse the order of words while keeping each word intact.
hintsList: Split string into words, reverse the array of words, then join them back with spaces.

problems.title: Check if One String is Rotation of Another
problems.description:
Check if string s2 is a rotation of string s1. A rotation means shifting characters circularly. For example, "rotation" is a rotation of "tionrota". Print "true" if s2 is a rotation of s1, otherwise print "false".

Input Format:
First line contains first string s1.
Second line contains second string s2.

Output Format:
Print "true" if s2 is rotation of s1, otherwise print "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
rotation
tionrota

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
hello
world

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
"tionrota" is obtained by rotating "rotation" - shifting characters circularly.
hintsList: Concatenate s1 with itself. If s2 is a substring of this concatenated string and lengths match, it's a rotation.

problems.title: Count Substrings with Same First and Last Character
problems.description:
Count the number of substrings in a given string that have the same first and last character. Print the count.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the count of substrings with same first and last character.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
aba

Sample Output
4

Sample Input
abc

Sample Output
3

Explanation:
For "aba": substrings are "a", "b", "a", "ab", "ba", "aba". Those with same first and last: "a", "a", "aba", "aba" = 4 (note: substring "aba" appears in multiple positions). Actually, for "aba": "a"(0-0), "b"(1-1), "a"(2-2), "aba"(0-2) = 4.
hintsList: For each starting position, check all substrings starting from that position. Count those where first and last characters match.

problems.title: Find Longest Common Prefix
problems.description:
Given an array of strings, find the longest common prefix string. If there is no common prefix, print an empty string. For this problem, the input will be a single string containing space-separated words.

Input Format:
First line contains space-separated strings.

Output Format:
Print the longest common prefix.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
flower flow flight

Sample Output
fl

Sample Input
dog racecar car

Sample Output


Explanation:
For "flower flow flight", common prefix is "fl". For "dog racecar car", there is no common prefix.
problems.constraints:
1 <= number of strings <= 100
1 <= length of each string <= 1000
hintsList: Compare characters position by position. Start with first character of all strings, then second, etc. Stop when characters don't match.

problems.title: Find Longest Palindrome Substring
problems.description:
Find and print the longest palindrome substring in the given string. If multiple palindromes have the same maximum length, print the first one.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the longest palindrome substring.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
babad

Sample Output
bab

Sample Input
cbbd

Sample Output
bb

Explanation:
For "babad", palindromes include "bab", "aba", etc. Longest is "bab" (or "aba", print first one).
hintsList: For each position, expand around center (both odd and even length palindromes). Keep track of longest palindrome found.
